The Football Transfer Sources Reliability Guide

Football Transfer Source Reliability Tiers

Tier 1 – Almost undisputed when discussing a Transfer Rumour. They may not be the first to discuss a rumour, but if they are talking about it; then it is almost certainly true, and possibly close to complete.
Tier 2 – Known to have current sources, but are still fallible and just short of being considered an authority on rumour discussions. However, multiple individuals or sources from this tier reporting the same rumour may indicate a strong possibility of truth to the rumour.
Tier 3 – Unreliable, and not to be trusted solo. They fall into near click-bait practices and are often fighting for relevance in a sea of rumours.
Tier 4 – Not to be trusted at all. These companies make money out of ensuring that you read them and they will make up anything to get you to harness advertising revenue.
Tier 5 – Don’t waste your time reading them




(credit: false 9)

Sead Kolašinac has met Schalke sporting director Jochen Schneider ahead of potential move

Bild report tonight that Arsenal left-back Sead Kolašinac has met with Schalke sporting director Jochen Schneider three times in the past few weeks ahead of a potential loan deal.

The 27-year-old would like to return to his former club but for Schalke, it may not be financially feasible. The Bundesliga club must reach an agreement with Arsenal on how the Bosnian’s salary would be divided during his loan spell.

Arsenal appear to be willing to allow Kolašinac, who wants to return to Schalke for personal reasons, to leave the club. Bayer Leverkusen have also shown interest in signing the Bosnia international.

Vedad IbiševiÄ‡ undergoes Schalke medical

Former Hertha Berlin striker Vedad IbiševiÄ‡ has completed part one of his medical check and will undergo further tests on Wednesday before signing a one-year deal, according to Sport1.

The 36-year-old will take a considerable pay cut to join the Royal Blues, who are expected to complete the signing of IbiševiÄ‡ within the next 48 hours.

Cagliari in talks with Napoli for Ounas: the situation

Cagliari is looking to add a new piece to their squad after Sottil and Zappa (both of which should close between Tuesday night and Wednesday). The club is negotiating with Napoli for Adam Ounas. Initial contacts have been made with Napoli for the 23-year-old midfielder, for whom the asking price is €12m plus bonuses.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/cagliari-in-talks-with-napoli-for-ounas-the-situation

Juventus-Suarez contact continues: the latest

Juventus is proceeding quickly on the Luis Suarez front and the contacts between the two sides continue, as by now it seems that an principle economic agreement has been found. Now all that is left to be seen is how the negotiations between the player and Barcelona develop.

This is the situation tied to Juve's market for attackers which dances on several tables, as they await news from Edin Dzeko for an eventual deal between Roma and Napoli for an Under-Milik swap, which at this time is not coming to fruition. Juve, however, is working hard (more than ever in the past hours) for Suarez.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/juventus-suarez-contact-continues-the-latest

Milan, documents signed for Tonali: the latest

Milan have the definite arrival for Tonali, as the necessary documents were signed by Brescia President Massimo Cellino. The player is close to finalizing his move to Milan and he just has to wait to pass his medical vists and sign his new contract. Milan has been active on the transfer market, as they are waiting for Brahim Diaz from Real Madrid on a loan basis.

Genoa close in on Perin: to return on loan

Mattia Perin will once again play for Genoa. He will return to the club on loan from Juventus, who hold his playing rights. They are in the closing stage of the negotiations for the player. Perin played half a season with Genoa, as he was sent there on loan to help the club stave off relegation. He will be able to do so once again this season.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/genoa-close-in-on-perin-to-return-on-loan

Juventus and Atalanta in advanced talks over Romero: the details on the formula of the transfer

Atalanta continues to take in reinforcements for their defense. After bidding farewell to Castagne who heads to Leicester and closing for Karsdorp from Roma, the club is also preparing to make a decisive push for Juventus-owned center back Cristian Romero. Talks are in progress with the bianconeri.

The player's valuation is between €20-25m, the clubs are in negotiations over the formula: it could be a loan with fee for one year plus an purchase option which could become a forced option at certain conditions, or a two-year loan (still with purchase option which could become a forced option.)

Romero was purchased by Juventus in the summer of 2019, with the bianconeri leaving him on loan at Genoa where he played in 33 matches last season.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/juventus-and-atalanta-in-advanced-talks-over-romero-the-details-on-the-formula-of-the-transfer

Napoli considers signing Boga and Veretout funded by possible Koulibaly sale

Napoli's transfer market depends heavily on the future of Koulibaly: should he depart the main target to replace him is Papastathopoulos from Arsenal (sides are set to make a deal) and additionally Senesi from Feyenoord.

If Koulibaly leaves for Manchester City, Napoli would have the economic maneuverability to try to make improvements in other positions, such as Boga of Sassuolo for the attack and Veretout the Roma midfielder to replace Allan.

Sassuolo's asking price for Boga is €40m, and Veretout would require Roma selling a year after making an investment in him.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/napoli-considers-signing-boga-and-veretout-funded-by-possible-koulibaly-sale

Milan keep pushing to sign Bakayoko: coming hours will be decisive

Milan continue to be one of the most lively clubs on the market of the initial part of the transfer window.

After completing the signing of Sandro Tonali, the Rossoneri will focus on adding more players to their midfield. In this reagrd, the Italian club have made further progress in their pursuit of Chelsea's Tiemoué Bakayoko, who could return at the club after his loan spell two seasons ago.

The coming hours could be decisive, as Milan could make the final steps towards the completion of the deal.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/milan-keep-pushing-to-sign-bakayoko-coming-hours-will-be-decisive

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/en-borja-valero-genoa-parma-and-verona-interested-in-midfielder

Juventus make progress on Suarez front: Barcelona could receive compensation formed as bonus payment

Juventus-Suarez, contacts continue between the sides. The economic agreement seems ever closer, but the transfer is not yet a go. The bianconeri are awaiting news on the Barcelona front, who must let Suarez leave and give him the severance pay he wishes for.

Juventus is counting on its very good relationship with Barcelona to see through the Suarez deal, not excluding that there could be a small solidarity payment made to the blaugrana: the reimbursement would take the shape of a bonus set to certain conditions in order to facilitate the conclusion of the deal.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/juventus-make-progress-on-suarez-front-barcelona-could-receive-compensation-formed-as-bonus-payment

RB Leipzig make €13m offer for Ricardo Horta (SC Braga)

As reported by Sky Germany, RB Leipzig have made an opening offer of €13 million for 25-year-old SC Braga attacker Ricardo Horta.

The Bundesliga club view the Portugal international as an alternative to Werder Bremen attacker Milot Rashica, whom they’ve been unable to reach an agreement with. The two clubs are too far apart financially and it appears that Julian Nagelsmann has identified other targets.

Horta scored 12 and created six in Liga NOS for Braga last season.

Lyon reject low ball bid from Fulham for winger Bertrand Traoré

Premier League side Fulham have had an opening bid for Burkina Faso international Bertrand Traoré rejected by Lyon, according to our colleagues at Foot Mercato.

OL are seeking a €25m fee for a player that they are actively seeking to offload this summer – Sky Sports were the first outlet to report the Cottagers’ interest in Traoré.

Brighton are also very interested in the ex-Chelsea man and are weighing up a bid, whilst Newcastle United, Everton and Crystal Palace have all been targeted by agents but have not yet made any move for the 24-year-old.
Leicester City are interested in St Étienne central defender Wesley Fofana, but no formal bids at this stage, according to sources contacted by Get French Football News. More follows.

Marseille seeking to offload Lopez, Mitroglou, Strootman, Rocchia & Germain

La Provence report that Marseille have informed five players that they should move on during this transfer window.

They are midfielders Kevin Strootman & Maxime Lopez, left-back Christopher Rocchia. Strikers Valère Germain & Kostas Mitroglou.

OM will also look to sign a new striker, and have a budget of between €5m to €6m to do so. The profile of player they are looking for a is a youngster who can be sold on for much more within the next two years.

Adil Rami talks with Serie B side Reggina break down

Talks between 34-year-old French international central defender Adil Rami and Serie B side Reggina have broken down, according to L’Équipe.

Reggina expected to sign the Frenchman this week, but the club’s Sporting Director, Massimo Taibi, announced that talks are off: “We are no longer expecting anyone, we have decided to bring negotiations to an end.”

Arsenal summer clearout intensifies as Lucas Torreira nears exit to join Fiorentina on loan

Lucas Torreira is close to joining Fiorentina on loan as Arsenal step up their attempt at a summer clearout.

The Italian club have an outline agreement to sign the Uruguay midfielder, 24, for a £7.1 million fee and will have the option of making the move permanent next summer for an additional £14.2 million.

https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/arsenal-summer-clearout-intensifies-as-lucas-torreira-nears-exit-to-join-fiorentina-on-loan-2nz772r7r

Benevento close deal for Caprari: the details

After making progress in recent days, Benevento have now closed the deal for Gianluca Caprari. The Sampdoria striker will join the newly promoted club on loan for €1.5 million with an option to buy set at €7.5 million, this is another acquisition completed by sporting director Pasquale Foggia.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/benevento-close-deal-for-caprari-the-details

Juventus, Mandragora to stay at Udinese

Rolando Mandragora will stay at Udinese. He will not move to Juventus even though there was an option to buy him back for 26 million euros. There was a meeting today between Juventus and his agents and it was decided that he will stay with the Friulani. An agreement is still in place that will allow Juventus to buy back Mandragora at the end of the season.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/juventus-mandragora-to-stay-at-udinese
According to @FabrizioRomano , Arsenal are not interested in Roma midfielder Amadou Diawara.
Oh Marina

Real Madrid interested in Dani Olmo (RB Leipzig), no formal bids

Bild report this afternoon that La Liga club Real Madrid are interested in signing 22-year-old RB Leipzig midfielder Dani Olmo.

The Bundesliga club are yet to receive an offer for the Spaniard, and would be be reluctant to accept any form of offer after Olmo arrived from €21m in January. Per Bild, Real Madrid would be ready to pay €40m which could test RB Leipzig’s resolve.

Olmo has a contract until 2024.

Angers in talks with Loïs Diony (St Étienne)

Ligue 1 side Angers have entered into conversations with 27-year-old French attacker Loïs Diony about a possible transfer from St Étienne, according to L’Équipe.

Bayern star Martinez sets sights on Athletic homecoming

Bayern Munich midfielder Javi Martinez is determined to seal a move back to Athletic this summer after eight trophy-laden seasons at the Allianz Arena.

https://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/bayern-star-martinez-sets-sights-on-athletic-homecoming/1e6ec15oz07u1ivsvcn8i06vb

Sevilla prepare final bid for Barco

Sevilla are preparing their final approach for Atalanta United's Exequiel Barco, reports Es Noticia.

The 21-year-old could move to Spain for a fee approaching €15 million (£13.4m/$17.8m), after just shy of three years in MLS.

https://esnoticia.net/sevilla-fc-ezequiel-barco/amp/

FC Nantes in talks to sign Frédéric Guilbert from Aston Villa

Ligue 1 side FC Nantes have entered into discussions to sign French right-back Frédéric Guilbert from Premier League side Aston Villa, according to our colleagued Mohamed Toubache-TER.

Les Canaris have been seeking an upgrade in the right-back position and have intense interest in the ex-Caen man – for the moment, there is no formal bid on the table, as FCN try to get a sense of what Villa’s demands might be.

Brest working on a deal for Huddersfield striker Steve Mounié

As reported by L’Équipe, Ligue 1 side Brest are working on a deal to sign 25-year-old Benin international striker Steve Mounié from Championship club Huddersfield Town.

Dijon to sign Bersant Celina from Swansea on a 4-year contract

Ligue 1 side Dijon have reached an agreement with Championship club Swansea to sign 23-year-old Kosovo international attacking midfielder Bersat Celina for an undisclosed fee, according to Foot Mercato and L’Équipe.

A 4-year contract is in the offing for Celina, who is due to undergo a medical at the end of this week.

Spezia in talks with PSV over goalkeeper Zoet

After completing the signing of right-back Jacopo Sala and closing in on Ismajli, Spezia are working to bring in a new goalkeeper.

The newly promoted club is in talks with PSV for goalkeeper Jeroen Zoet. The 29-year-old Dutch shot-stopper, who played on loan at Utrecht last season, was also in the radar of Roma last summer. Spezia are keen on signing the players and the talks with PSV are ongoing.

Lyon boss Rudi Garcia “would really like” to bring back Samuel Umtiti

Speaking to TF1, Lyon boss Rudi Garcia admitted that he would like to bring French international central defender Samuel Umtiti back to the club, but added “I do not believe that it will be possible.”

Umtiti is under contract with Barcelona until June 2023 and has been with the Catalan side since 2016 after five seasons at OL.

He played just 18 matches in all competitions for Barça last season, compared to the tally of 40 that his compatriot Clement Lenglet can count.

replies.msg: Lyon have rejected a £35m + player offer for Houssem Aouar from Arsenal [ @RMCsport ].

FC Köln & Augsburg interested in Yoshinori Muto (Newcastle United)

According to our colleagues at FussballTransfers, several Bundesliga clubs are interested in signing 28-year-old Newcastle United striker Yoshinori Muto.

The Japan international has attracted interest from FC Köln, Arminia Bielefeld, Augsburg and his former club, Mainz 05. Muto has a contract with the Premier League club until 2022 but has failed to impress since joining the Magpies in 2018.

Sofiane Boufal available for €4m

Our colleagues at Foot Mercato report that 26-year-old Moroccan international attacking midfielder Sofiane Boufal has been made available by Southampton this summer for €4m.

Under contract with the Saints until June 2021, now the player feels is the time find a club and a coach who believe in him and his dribbling and breaking the lines qualities. At the moment, there is nothing concrete, aside from strong interest from Real Betis.

Atalanta make contact for St Étienne attacker Denis Bouanga

Serie A side Atalanta have entered into contact with Gabonese international Denis Bouanga about a possible transfer from St Étienne, according to our colleague Mohamed Toubache-TER.

The 25-year-old is in active discussions with the Italian side, but ASSE have not received a formal offer from the Champions’ League quarter-finalists as of yet.

Atalanta had also been looking at Marseille winger Florian Thauvin, but sources tell Get French Football News that they have concerns relating to the asking price.

Today Aleksandar Kolarov is becoming a new Inter player: the Serbian full-back will arrive in Milan with a private flight from Serbia, after yesterday's Nations League match against Turkey.

Mike McGrath's transfer notebook: Everton keeping tabs on Valencia striker Maxi Gomez

Meanwhile, Tiemoue Bakayoko nears Chelsea exit and Danny Graham returns to Sunderland

Everton have asked about Valencia striker Maxi Gomez to add a striker to Carlo Ancelotti's summer spending.

Gomez, 24, will be allowed to leave the Mestalla ahead of the transfer deadline in October as the Spanish club look to trim their squad to cut costs.

Ancelotti has made moves for Allan and Abdoulaye Doucoure for his midfield and playmaker James Rodriguez but would also welcome an out-and-out striker and has interest in Gomez.

The Uruguay striker moved to Valencia a year ago from Celta Vigo for £13million but they will take a hit on their investment as they look to sell players.

Ancelotti has Dominic Calvert-Lewin as a No9 and has also played Richarlison up front, while Moise Kean has fallen out of favour.

Tiemoue Bakayoko almost off Chelsea's books

Chelsea midfielder Tiemoue Bakayoko has edged closer to a move to AC Milan but has also been monitored by Crystal Palace.

Palace have previously taken Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Michy Batshuayi on loan and Conor Gallagher has been lined up this season, with Bakayoko also on their radar.

Everton considered the Frenchman, 26, but ended up signing Allan from Napoli. There does not appear to be hope of Bakayoko spending the campaign at Stamford Bridge as he is not training with the first team.

Danny Graham returns to Weirside

Danny Graham has joined Sunderland on an initial one-year deal after leaving Blackburn Rovers this summer.

It is a return to the Stadium of Light for the 35-year-old after leaving the north-east for Ewood Park four years ago.

Fulham's Steven Sessegnon to get loan time

Fulham full-back Steven Sessegnon has agreed a season-long loan at Bristol City in the Championship to give him first-team experience.

The 20-year-old is behind Antonee Robinson in the pecking order at Craven Cottage following his arrival from Wigan Athletic.

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2020/09/07/mike-mcgraths-transfer-notebook-everton-keeping-tabs-valencia/

Mattia Destro stays at Genoa: it's official.

"The stay of striker Mattia Destro has been formalized", reads the official website of Genoa. The striker born in 1991 had arrived on loan from Bologna last January, playing eight matches in the second half of the season. Today the official confirmation of what everybody was expecting: Mattia Destro will continue his career with Genoa, the club that made him debut in Serie A ten years ago.

Fiorentina working on Borja Valero’s return

After his experience at Inter came to an end, Borja Valero could return to Fiorentina. The Spanish midfielder's contract with the nerazzurri recently expired, his agent is on his way to Italy to work on the potential move. Borja Valero played at Fiorentina between 2012 and 2017 and has strong ties to the city- he put his negotiation with Verona on stand by after turning down Genoa.

Fiorentina would have to move a midfielder to open up a slot for Borja Valero, especially after also being on the verge of signing Bonaventura.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/fiorentina-working-on-borja-valeros-return

Parma, blitz for Luperto.

On Sebastiano Luperto there is not only Genoa. In fact, for the Italian center born in '96, Parma is now trying to close with Napoli in order to anticipate the rossoblù.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/parma-blitz-for-luperto

Inter, Handanovic renewals until 2022.

Handanovic has signed the renewal with Inter until 2022. The Slovenian goalkeeper, with his contract expiring in 2021, has therefore extended his relationship with the Nerazzurri by another year.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/en-inter-handanovic-renewal-until-2022

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2020/09/07/chelsea-aiming-complete-goalkeeper-edouard-mendy-signing/

Real Madrid striker Borja Mayoral has been waiting on Valencia to make a bid for the last five weeks. His representatives will now fly to Italy to hold talks with AS Roma, Lazio and one other club, according to @Generaldepie_ .

Lois Diony will join Angers on a 3-year contract

L’Équipe report that Angers have struck an agreement with fellow Ligue 1 side St Étienne over the signing of 27-year-old French attacker Lois Diony.

He is expected to travel to Angers to sign a 3-year contract, potentially as quickly as tomorrow, should he pass the traditional medical.

Diony has struggled to establish himself as a reliable Ligue 1 forward since bursting onto the scene with Dijon, performances that led to ASSE buying him back in 2017.

N’Golo Kanté will be staying at Chelsea

Téléfoot Chaine report that French international central midfielder N’Golo Kanté will be remaining at Chelsea, despite interest from a number of clubs including Inter Milan.

The 29-year-old has never wanted to leave the Blues and the London club never had any intention of selling him.

Bertrand Traoré: “I need to play, I have no time to waste.”

Speaking in an interview with a Burkina Faso publication, L’Étalon, Lyon winger Bertrand Traoré sought to confirm that he would seek to exit the club before this transfer window comes to and end. The 25-year-old has a contract until June 2022.

https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2020/bertrand-traore-i-need-to-play-i-have-no-time-to-waste/

Brest will sign Steve Mounié for €5m

L’Équipe report that Benin international attacker Steve Mounié will sign for Ligue 1 side Brest on Tuesday for €5m, moving from Championship club Huddersfield Town in the process.

Mounié will sign a 4-year contract with SB29 after being successfully convinced to return to the French top flight, having left Montpellier in 2017 for the Yorkshire club where he is spending his final hours.
No fee agreement yet between Chelsea & Rennes for Édouard Mendy, but talks ongoing, according to @B_Quarez .

Rennes to make opening €20m offer to Lyon for Jeff Reine-Adélaïde

L’Équipe report that Ligue 1 rivals Rennes intend to make an audacious bid for Lyon’s France U21s international attacking midfielder Jeff Reine-Adélaïde, after the ex-Arsenal man announced his desire to quit OL last week.

Fiorentina keen on a deal for Alfredo Morelos

24-year-old Rangers attacker Alfredo Morelos is now the target of interest from Serie A side Fiorentina, according to Foot Mercato.

The Colombian international is understood to be top of their shortlist as we head into the final weeks of the transfer window. Lille agreed personal terms with Morelos earlier on in the window, but he was merely a back-up target behind Canadian international Jonathan David.

Rangers, who are ready to sell the player after sidelining him for the match vs Kilmarnock, still want €20m in order to part with the forward.

Emi Martínez has been offered a new contract by Arsenal but that the parties remain some way apart. Negotiations are ongoing but Villa are prepared to improve on Arsenal’s financial package while promising that he will begin as their first choice. [ @guardian ]

Arsenal recently received an enhanced offer this week. Martínez wants to stay at Arsenal but is aware that regular starts are a priority given that he turned 28 last week. [ @guardian @NickAmes82 ]

Bayern are looking intensively on the market for a right-back. Sergiño Dest remains an option. However, the club is not willing to pay more than €10m. On the other hand, Ajax want at least €20m. Bayern's scouts also have a talent from Spain on the radar [ @cfbayern , @SPORTBILD ]

The future of both treble winning centre backs is in doubt. For Alaba, no agreement is in sight, while for Boateng the club has not opened contract talks. In case of offers from other clubs, A sale of both players is not ruled out [ @cfbayern , @SPORTBILD ]

Despite interest from Barcelona, Thiago is unlikely to return to his former club due to Barça's financial problems and the fact that Ronald Koeman prefers Wijnaldum. Thiago has an agreement with Liverpool but the clubs are yet to agree a fee. Bayern want no less than €30m [Bild]

Napoli asking for Cagliari's Nandez to move Ounas: the latest

Cagliari are in the closing stages for Fazio, where he will be teaming up with former Roma manager Eusebio Di Francesco. Cagliari will pay 2.5 million euros plus 500,000 euros in bonuses to Roma.

Cagliari have identified Napoli's Ounas as an objective to reinforce their forward line. Napoli want to add Nandez into any potential negotiations to reinforce their midfield after Allan's departure. There have been initial contact from Napoli.

Roma agree personal terms with Smalling: Giallorossi set to step up negotiations with Manchester United

After a succesful loan spell in Serie A, Chris Smalling is set to return to Roma. The Giallorossi have in fact rached an agreement over personal terms with the English centre-back, who has agreed to sign a one-year deal with Roma.

Now the Italian clubs are confident they will try to reach a final agreement with Manchester United, whom Smalling is contracted to until 2022. The discussions between the parties are ongoing and the next few days will be decisive.

Papu Gómez offered a two-year deal by Al-Nasr

Sky Sport Italia report this afternoon that Atalanta’s Papu Gómez has been offered a two-year deal worth €6m a season by Saudi club Al-Nasr, with a transfer fee amounting to €15m proposed to La Dea.

The Argentine has not made his decision yet, although his current contract ties him to Atalanta for another two years. The Al-Nasr management will be in Italy by the weekend to convince the player to leave Bergamo, with a new season in the Champions League on the horizon.

Bayer Leverkusen interested in Florian Thauvin & Bouna Sarr

France Football report that German side Bayer Leverkusen are interested in Marseille duo Florian Thauvin and Bouna Sarr, as they seek to make acquisitions following the departures of Kai Havertz to Chelsea and Kevin Volland to AS Monaco.

Manager Peter Bosz wants to sign Thauvin to associated him up front with Moussa Diaby and Partick Schick, who they have just bought for €27m.

They are also looking for a right-back and they have identified 28-year-old Bouna Sarr, convinced by his offensive abilities. Elements to watch in the coming days.
